title-group.article-title: Constructing Representations of Higher Degrees of Finite Simple Groups and Covers

abstract.p: Let G be a finite group and × an irreducible character of G. A simple method for constructing a representation affording × can be used whenever G has a subgroup H such that ×H has a linear constituent with multiplicity 1. In this paper we show that (with a few exceptions) if G is a simple group or a covering group of a simple group and × is an irreducible character of G of degree between 32 and 100, then such a subgroup exists.
